definitions: having been cut with shears or similar sharp tool
examples: The sheep looked different with their sheared wool
We admired the neatly sheared hedges in the garden

definitions: covered with a protective layer or case that surrounds something
examples: The sword remained sheathed in its leather scabbard
The building featured sheathed copper pipes for protection

definitions: having been naturally dropped or lost from the body
examples: The snake's shed skin lay among the rocks
Scientists collected shed feathers for DNA analysis

definitions: having the outer shell or husk removed from something
having been attacked with explosive shells or artillery fire
examples: The recipe calls for shelled walnuts and almonds
We bought shelled peas to save preparation time
The shelled buildings showed signs of heavy damage
Civilians fled from the shelled neighborhoods during conflict

definitions: protected from weather, wind, or other natural elements
protected from difficulties, dangers, or unpleasant experiences in life
examples: The sheltered cove provided safe anchorage for boats
We found a sheltered spot for our picnic
Her sheltered upbringing left her unprepared for challenges
The sheltered students had never experienced real hardship

definitions: protected by a physical or metaphorical barrier from harm or detection
examples: The shielded cables prevented electromagnetic interference
Workers wore shielded helmets in the construction zone

definitions: continuously moving or changing position, direction, or focus
examples: The shifting sands made walking difficult on beach
Her shifting opinions confused everyone at the meeting

definitions: appearing evasive, untrustworthy, or likely to be dishonest
examples: His shifty eyes avoided direct contact during questioning
The dealer's shifty behavior made customers feel uncomfortable

definitions: giving out or reflecting bright light with a steady glow
exceptionally good, distinguished, or admirable in performance or quality
examples: The shining stars filled the clear night sky
Her shining hair caught everyone's attention at party
She was a shining example of dedication and hard work
His shining academic record impressed all the professors

definitions: having a smooth surface that reflects light brightly
examples: The child collected shiny pebbles from the riverbed
His shiny new shoes squeaked on the floor

definitions: occurring on or relating to activities aboard a ship
examples: The shipboard announcement warned passengers about rough seas
Shipboard entertainment included dancing and live music shows

definitions: shaking slightly and uncontrollably from cold, fear, or excitement
examples: The shivering puppy needed a warm blanket immediately
We found the shivering hikers lost in snow

definitions: feeling sudden upset, surprise, or disgust at something unexpected
affected by electric shock or sudden physical impact
examples: The shocked audience gasped at the revelation
Her shocked expression showed she hadn't expected news
The shocked patient recovered quickly from the defibrillator
He felt shocked after touching the exposed wire

definitions: causing intense surprise, disgust, or offense to someone
examples: The shocking news spread quickly through the office
Her shocking pink dress stood out at funeral

definitions: wearing shoes or having shoes put on the feet
examples: The poorly shod children needed new winter boots
All horses must be properly shod before the race

definitions: badly made or done with inferior materials and careless work
examples: The shoddy construction led to numerous customer complaints
We returned the shoddy furniture to the store

definitions: having hair or wool cut very short or removed completely
examples: The newly shorn sheep looked smaller without wool
His shorn head revealed several old scars underneath

definitions: made smaller in length, duration, or extent than before
examples: The shortened version excluded several important scenes
We took the shortened route to avoid traffic

definitions: written in or relating to a rapid abbreviated writing method
examples: The secretary's shorthand notes captured every important detail
Learning shorthand helped journalists work more efficiently

definitions: having shoulders of a specified type or carrying something on shoulders
examples: The broad shouldered athlete excelled at swimming events
She shouldered her way through the crowded market

definitions: spoken or called out in a very loud voice
examples: His shouted warnings saved people from falling debris
The shouted instructions were hard to understand clearly

definitions: having a striking appearance intended to attract attention or admiration
examples: The showy peacock displayed its colorful tail feathers
Her showy jewelry seemed inappropriate for the occasion

definitions: torn or cut into many thin strips or small pieces
having very defined muscles with low body fat percentage
examples: The recipe required two cups of shredded cheese
Important shredded documents filled the recycling bin
The shredded bodybuilder won first place in competition
His shredded physique took years of training

definitions: having or showing sharp judgment and clever understanding, especially in practical matters
examples: The shrewd investor doubled her money in one year
His shrewd observations about market trends proved accurate

definitions: making a high-pitched piercing sound that is unpleasant to hear
examples: The shrill whistle made everyone cover their ears
Her shrill voice carried across the noisy playground

definitions: having many shrubs or resembling a shrub in growth pattern
examples: The shrubby landscape required minimal maintenance and watering
We planted shrubby borders along the garden path

definitions: having become smaller than the normal or previous size
examples: The shrunken sweater no longer fit after washing
His shrunken appearance worried his family and friends

definitions: having windows covered with shutters or protective panels
permanently closed down as a business or operation
examples: The shuttered windows protected furniture from sun damage
We walked past shuttered houses during the storm
The shuttered factory left hundreds without employment
Many shuttered restaurants never reopened after the crisis

definitions: causing a feeling of nausea or physical disgust
causing moral revulsion or extreme disapproval
examples: The sickening smell made everyone leave the room
The ride's sickening loops weren't for weak stomachs
The sickening cruelty shocked even hardened investigators
His sickening disregard for safety caused multiple accidents

definitions: frequently ill or in poor health condition
having an unhealthy appearance suggesting illness or weakness
examples: The sickly child missed many days of school
Her sickly constitution required constant medical attention
The plant's sickly yellow leaves indicated nutrient deficiency
His sickly pale complexion concerned his colleagues

definitions: thrown with arm motion parallel to the ground rather than overhead
examples: The pitcher's sidearm delivery confused many batters consistently
He developed a sidearm throwing style after injury

definitions: moving or directed toward one side rather than forward
indirect, evasive, or not straightforward in manner
examples: The crab moved sideways across the sandy beach
She gave him a sideways glance during meeting
His sideways approach to criticism annoyed his boss
The sideways comment revealed her true feelings

definitions: having the ability to see, not blind
seen or observed, especially something rare or unusual
examples: The sighted guide helped blind tourists navigate museum
Programs served both sighted and visually impaired students
The rarely sighted bird excited all the photographers
Ships were sighted approaching from the eastern horizon

definitions: marked with a person's signature as authentication or approval
communicated using sign language for the deaf
examples: The signed contract became legally binding immediately
Fans treasured their signed photographs from the celebrity
The signed conversation allowed deaf students full participation
The signed performance made theater accessible to everyone

definitions: made unable to speak or express opinions through force or authority
examples: The silenced critics could no longer voice opposition
The silenced engine made the car much more pleasant

definitions: having the smooth, soft, lustrous qualities characteristic of silk
examples: Her silken hair shimmered in the afternoon sunlight
The cat's silken fur felt wonderful to touch

definitions: having a smooth, soft, and shiny texture like silk
examples: The dog's silky ears were pleasant to pet
She loved the silky texture of the fabric

definitions: containing or covered with fine sediment particles smaller than sand
examples: The silty river water wasn't suitable for drinking
Farmers valued the silty soil for growing crops

definitions: having the shiny gray-white color or appearance of silver
having a clear, light, ringing quality like silver bells
examples: The fish's silvery scales glinted in the water
Her silvery hair looked distinguished and elegant
Her silvery laugh delighted everyone at the party
The silvery notes from the flute filled the hall

definitions: relating to or resembling apes or monkeys in appearance or behavior
examples: His simian features included prominent brow and long arms
The actor's simian movements perfectly portrayed the character

definitions: treating complex issues as if they were much simpler than reality
examples: Her simplistic solution ignored many important factors involved
The simplistic analysis failed to address underlying problems

definitions: created artificially to imitate or reproduce real conditions or processes
examples: The simulated flight helped train pilots without risk
Scientists used simulated environments to test new theories

definitions: occurring, operating, or done at exactly the same time
examples: The simultaneous explosions indicated coordinated planning
Translation provided simultaneous interpretation for foreign delegates

definitions: free from pretense or deceit, expressing genuine feelings or beliefs
examples: His sincere apology helped repair their damaged friendship
We appreciated her sincere efforts to help everyone

definitions: considered morally wrong according to religious or ethical principles
examples: Many religions consider lying a sinful act
He felt sinful thoughts entering his troubled mind

definitions: producing musical sounds with the voice in melody
making a high-pitched whistling or ringing sound
examples: The singing birds welcomed the morning with melody
Her singing voice captivated the entire audience
The singing kettle announced that water was boiling
We heard singing bullets pass overhead in battle

definitions: extraordinary or remarkable in character, degree, or quality
being the only one of its kind, unique or individual
examples: She showed singular dedication to helping homeless people
His singular achievement earned international recognition
Each snowflake has a singular pattern never repeated
The singular specimen puzzled even expert scientists

definitions: giving the impression that something harmful or evil will happen
examples: The sinister clouds promised a dangerous storm ahead
His sinister smile made everyone feel deeply uncomfortable

definitions: having many curves and turns in a smooth, flowing manner
examples: The sinuous river wound through the mountain valley
Dancers moved in sinuous patterns across the stage

definitions: considered unmanly or showing weakness according to traditional gender stereotypes
examples: His father wrongly called him sissy for showing emotions
The sissy stereotype prevents boys from expressing feelings
